player: Mike Scott did not play in the D-League on Wednesday due to lower left leg muscle soreness.
Tiago Splitter will miss at least six more weeks with a right calf strain.
Rondae Hollis-Jefferson (right hip tendinitis) will not play against the Pacers on Thursday.
Jeremy Lin (hamstring) remains without an official timetable to return.
James Young (right ankle sprain) has been ruled out of Tuesday's game vs. the Jazz.
Tyler Zeller (illness) will not suit up for Tuesday's game against the Jazz.
Cody Zeller (concussion) passed the first series of tests in the concussion protocol and remains out for Wednesday against the Thunder.
Fred Hoiberg said that Denzel Valentine is dealing with "significant swelling" in his sprained left ankle, and he's uncertain when he'll be able to return to the court.
Kevin Love (illness) and Kyrie Irving (hamstring) will not play against the Bulls on Wednesday.
Mike Dunleavy (ankle) was available to play on Wednesday but he picked up a DNP-CD.
Kyrie Irving (hamstring) will not play against the Bulls on Wednesday.
J.R. Smith’s thumb surgery was completed on Friday morning and the Cavs announced his "return to play timeline is currently projected at 12-14 weeks."
Chris Anderson suffered a torn ACL in his right knee and will be out for the rest of the season.
J.J. Barea (leg) will not play on Thursday vs. the Suns as expected.
Kenneth Faried (back) is being listed as questionable for Thursday's game against the Spurs.
Michael Gbinije (left forearm) is listed as out on Tuesday vs. the Pacers.
Aron Baynes (ankle) is not expected to play on Thursday vs. Charlotte.
Reggie Bullock (knee) returned to practice on Wednesday.
Patrick Beverley (wrist) is now a game-time call against the Thunder on Thursday.
The Rockets have confirmed that Clint Capela has a small fracture in his left fibula and will be re-evaluated in approximately four weeks.
Rodney Stuckey (sore left hamstring) will miss Tuesday's game vs. Detroit.
Chris Paul could return on Friday vs. the Kings if his hamstring responds well in practice on Thursday.
Blake Griffin underwent successful arthroscopic right knee surgery on Tuesday, and his timetable to return has been set at 4-6 weeks.
Brice Johnson (back) will not play opening night.
Luol Deng (right biceps tendinitis) did not practice on Wednesday and  is listed as questionable for Thursday's game in Portland.
Larry Nance (knee) did some work on a weight-bearing treadmill on Thursday.
Chandler Parsons (rest) will not play against the Clippers on Wednesday.
JaMychal Green (face) will not play Wednesday against the Clippers.
Deyonta Davis suffered a torn plantar fascia and will miss 6-8 weeks.
Brandan Wright underwent arthroscopic ankle surgery on Tuesday and is out indefinitely.
Justise Winslow (right shoulder) will have surgery on Thursday to repair a torn labrum and is likely out for the rest of the season.
Hassan Whiteside (eye) is making progress and should be able to rejoin the team this weekend in Los Angeles.
Josh McRoberts (stress reaction in left foot) is out indefinitely, according to coach Erik Spoelstra.
Nikola Pekovic hinted that he may retire from the game of basketball.
Matthew Dellavedova (hamstring) has been ruled out for Wednesday's game against the Knicks.
Rashad Vaughn (left ankle sprain) said he's likely going to be out a "couple of weeks."
Khris Middleton (hamstring) said he's not running at full speed yet.
Tyreke Evans (back spasms) is questionable for Thursday's game vs. the Hawks.
Quincy Pondexter underwent successful arthroscopic left knee surgery on Wednesday morning.
Kristaps Porzingis (sore left Achilles) was a full participant at Thursday's practice.
Cameron Payne scored 14 points in the D-League on Wednesday.
Robert Covington (back) is questionable for Friday's game vs. the Celtics.
Joel Embiid (gastroenteritis) is questionable for Friday's game vs. the Celtics.
Sergio Rodriguez (left ankle) is probable for Friday's game vs. the Celtics.
Gerald Henderson (hip) is probable for Friday's game vs. the Celtics .
The 76ers have recalled Richaun Holmes (concussion) from the D-League.
Jerryd Bayless (left wrist) had surgery on Thursday and is expected to miss the rest of the season.
76ers coach Brett Brown said Ben Simmons is "coming along fine."
Earn Watson said on Tuesday that Brandon Knight's lack of effort on the defensive end and poor fit with the team's culture has resulted in his lack of playing time as of late.
Damian Lillard (sprained ankle) will not  play vs. the Warriors on Wednesday.
Festus Ezeli (knee) is likely to undergo season-ending surgery.
Rudy Gay (right hip) will not play against the Heat on Wednesday.
Patrick Patterson (ankle) will not play on Tuesday vs. the Spurs.
Jared Sullinger (foot) is no longer in a walking boot.
Delon Wright (shoulder) is back to doing on-court work.
George Hill (concussion) will not play Thursday vs. Toronto.
Dante Exum (knee) is available to play on Thursday vs. the Raptors.
With Ian Mahinmi (knees) expected to miss at least six weeks, Wizards coach Scott Brooks said he will "definitely" consider more small-ball lineups.
Danuel House (wrist) suffered a fractured right wrist.
